question: During transcription the DNA strand with <katex>$3'\rightarrow5'$</katex> polarity of the structural gene always acts as a template because
choices: Enzyme DNA dependent RNA polymerase always catalyses polymerisation in both the directions.
Enzyme DNA dependent RNA polymerase always catalyses the polymerisation <katex>$5'\rightarrow3'$</katex> directions.
Nucleotides of DNA strand with <katex>$5'\rightarrow3'$</katex> are transferred to mRNA.
Enzyme DNA dependent RNA polymerase always catalyses the polymerisation <katex>$3'\rightarrow5'$</katex> directions.
explanation: RNA polymerase catalyzes polymerization only in the <katex>$5' \rightarrow 3'$</katex> direction. Therefore, the DNA strand with <katex>$3' \rightarrow 5'$</katex> polarity acts as the template.
